text: today I'm gonna share a recipe with you
that's just in time for grilling season
it's a chicken chili burger that you can
cook inside like I am or you can cook
outside on your grill so to start with
I'm just chopping up one cup of cilantro
leaves of course they're washed and well
dried cilantro is one of those things
like a lot of the softer herbs sort of
lose their flavor when you're cooking
them but cilantro holds up really well
in cooked food so I use it all the time
in lots of different ways today it's
going into a chicken burger which could
just as easily be a turkey burger
completely up to you this is one pound
of ground chicken add your cilantro
right to the bowl then to that add two
cans of chilies that are drained let me
show you the can just so you know what
you're looking for there these little
cans they're not too spicy these are
called chopped green chilies they come
chopped for you you drain those that
goes in to your chicken mixture make
sure it's really well drained because
too much moisture in the chicken can
give it like a weird texture and then on
top of it this is one teaspoon of cumin
seeds that you then you toast and then
grind make sure they're toasted ahead of
time and half a teaspoon of coarse salt
now you need to mix this you can use
gloves if that's your preferred way I'm
just gonna go ahead and mix it and then
wash my hands after form into four
patties of about equal size I'm gonna
sort of just make some dollops so I get
them even before I form them now this
mixture is pretty soft which can be hard
on the grill what I like to do often
especially if I'm grilling outside is
form my patties and then chill them in
the refrigerator and that firms them up
quite a bit it makes it a lot easier to
grill shape them and Pat them into shape
all right oil your the grates of your
grill and I actually like to go one step
further and just drizzle a little oil on
my burgers for safety place on the grill
I'm doing it the oil side down as you
can see these are SuperDuper delicate at
this stage but as they cook they should
firm up
right now you can go wash your hands I'm
gonna slice up some tomato while I wait
to turn you should take about eight to
ten minutes total and you're gonna grill
some thickly sliced tomatoes to go
alongside so you can get those ready as
well about a half an inch thick
grilling Tomatoes can be great and it
can be time pair if your slices are too
thin if your grill isn't hot enough or
oiled enough all kinds of things could
go wrong
hopefully that won't happen to me now
they released now you can turn and cook
the other side it is sticking a little I
feel like I didn't know my grill enough
and as I recommended I think you should
Chili's before you do this because
chicken is very very delicate I'm gonna
put my tomatoes on now give them a
little bit of oil and a little bit of
salt and then right on your grill yeah
have a tray prepared waiting for you to
take things off of the grill and your
tray should obviously be not the one
that you formed your patties on because
that would be discussing and also really
bad for you but a clean tray get the
tomatoes you don't want to overcook them
that's when they're gonna start mushing
and sticking you're just getting a
little bit of charge so really just a
nice additional flavor the burgers are
almost done I'm gonna take the tomatoes
off get those not overcooking and then
let's see about these burgers they
should be done they're coming off there
we go now it's time to eat you guys you
want to have some grilled buns if you
like lightly toast it I'm gonna leave
this one on while I build the bottom a
little bit of mustard some sour cream
both you say yes I say I like to do

burger mmm a little bit of cilantro some

I'm gonna put this down for one sec
